en: The descendants of Seth were called the sons of God; the descendants of Cain, the sons of men. As the sons of God mingled with the sons of men, they became corrupt and, by intermarriage with them, lost, through the influence of their wives, their peculiar, holy character, and united with the sons of Cain in their idolatry. Many cast aside the fear of God and trampled upon His commandments. But there were a few that did righteousness, who feared and honored their Creator. Noah and his family were among the righteous few.

The wickedness of man was so great, and increased to such a fearful extent, that God repented that He had made man upon the earth, for He saw that the wickedness of man was great, and that every imagination of the thoughts of his heart was only evil continually. More than one hundred years before the Flood the Lord sent an angel to faithful Noah to make known to him that He would no longer have mercy upon the corrupt race.

Noah was to preach to the people, and also to prepare an ark as God should direct him for the saving of himself and family. He was not only to preach, but his example in building the ark was to convince all that he believed what he preached. Noah and his family were not alone in fearing and obeying God. But Noah was the most pious and holy of any upon the earth, and was the one whose life God preserved to carry out His will in building the ark and warning the world of its coming doom.

God gave all who chose an opportunity to repent and turn to Him. But they believed not the preaching of Noah. They mocked at his warnings and ridiculed the building of that immense vessel on dry land. Noah’s efforts to reform his fellow men did not succeed. But for more than one hundred years he persevered in his efforts to turn men to repentance and to God. Every blow struck upon the ark was preaching to the people. Noah directed, he preached, he worked, while the people looked on in amazement and regarded him as a fanatic.
sw: Wazao wa Sethi waliitwa wana wa Mungu; wazao wa Kaini waliitwa wana wa wanadamu. Wana wa Mungu walipochanganyika na wana wa wanadamu, wakawa wapotovu na, kwa kuoana nao, walipoteza tabia yao takatifu na ya pekee kupitia ushawishi wa wake zao, na kuungana na wana wa Kaini katika ibada yao ya sanamu. Wengi walitupilia mbali hofu ya Mungu na kuzikanyaga amri Zake. Lakini walikuwapo wachache waliotenda haki, waliomcha na kumheshimu Muumba wao. Nuhu na familia yake walikuwa miongoni mwa wale wachache wenye haki.

Uovu wa mwanadamu ulikuwa mkubwa sana, na uliongezeka kwa kiasi cha kutisha, kiasi kwamba Mungu alijuta kwamba amemfanya mwanadamu duniani, kwani aliona kuwa uovu wa mwanadamu ulikuwa mkubwa, na kwamba kila fikira ya mawazo ya moyo wake ilikuwa mbaya tu daima. Zaidi ya miaka mia moja kabla ya Gharika, Bwana alimtuma malaika kwa Nuhu mwaminifu ili kumfahamisha kuwa Hatakuwa na rehema tena juu ya kizazi hicho kipotovu.

Nuhu alipaswa kuhubiri kwa watu, na pia kuandaa safina kama Mungu alivyomwelekeza kwa ajili ya kujiokoa yeye na familia yake. Hakupaswa kuhubiri tu, bali mfano wake katika kujenga safina ulipaswa kuwashawishi wote kwamba aliamini kile alichokihubiri. Nuhu na familia yake hawakuwa peke yao katika kumcha na kumtii Mungu. Lakini Nuhu alikuwa mcha Mungu na mtakatifu zaidi ya yeyote duniani, na ndiye ambaye Mungu alihifadhi maisha yake ili kutekeleza mapenzi Yake katika kujenga safina na kuuonya ulimwengu juu ya maangamizi yake yanayokuja.

Mungu alimpa kila aliyechagua fursa ya kutubu na kumgeukia Yeye. Lakini hawakuamini mahubiri ya Nuhu. Walidhihaki maonyo yake na kucheka ujenzi wa chombo kile kikubwa nchi kavu. Jitihada za Nuhu za kuwarekebisha wanadamu wenzake hazikufanikiwa. Lakini kwa zaidi ya miaka mia moja alivumilia katika jitihada zake za kuwageuza watu kwenye toba na kwa Mungu. Kila pigo lililopigwa juu ya safina lilikuwa ni mahubiri kwa watu. Nuhu alielekeza, alihubiri, na alifanya kazi, wakati watu wakitazama kwa mshangao na kumchukulia kama mwehu.

en: The cross reveals God’s love and justice
Christ bore the penalty of sin
Salvation is a gift through sacrifice
sw: Msalaba unaonyesha upendo na haki ya Mungu
Kristo alichukua adhabu ya dhambi
Wokovu ni zawadi kupitia dhabihu

en: God gave Noah the exact dimensions of the ark and explicit directions in regard to the construction of it in every particular. In many respects it was not made like a vessel but prepared like a house, the foundation like a boat which would float upon water. There were no windows in the sides of the ark. It was three stories high, and the light they received was from a window in the top. The door was in the side. The different apartments prepared for the reception of different animals were so made that the window in the top gave light to all. The ark was made of the cypress or gopher wood, which would know nothing of decay for hundreds of years. It was a building of great durability, which no wisdom of man could invent. God was the designer, and Noah His master builder.

After Noah had done all in his power to make every part of the work correct, it was impossible that it could of itself withstand the violence of the storm which God in His fierce anger was to bring upon the earth. The work of completing the building was a slow process. Every piece of timber was closely fitted, and every seam covered with pitch. All that men could do was done to make the work perfect; yet, after all, God alone could preserve the building upon the angry, heaving billows, by His miraculous power.

A multitude at first apparently received the warning of Noah, yet did not fully turn to God with true repentance. There was some time given them before the Flood was to come, in which they were to be placed upon probation—to be proved and tried. They failed to endure the trial. The prevailing degeneracy overcame them, and they finally joined others who were corrupt in deriding and scoffing at faithful Noah. They would not leave off their sins but continued in polygamy and in the indulgence of their corrupt passions.

The period of their probation was drawing near its close. The unbelieving, scoffing inhabitants of the world were to have a special sign of God’s divine power. Noah had faithfully followed the instructions God had given to him. The ark was finished exactly as God had directed. He had laid in store immense quantities of food for man and beast. And after this was accomplished, God commanded the faithful Noah, “Come thou and all thy house into the ark; for thee have I seen righteous before Me.”
sw: Mungu alimpa Nuhu vipimo kamili vya safina na maelekezo ya wazi kuhusiana na ujenzi wake katika kila kipengele. Katika mambo mengi haikutengenezwa kama merikebu bali iliandaliwa kama nyumba, msingi wake ukiwa kama boti ambayo ingeelea juu ya maji. Hapakuwa na madirisha pembeni mwa safina. Ilikuwa na urefu wa ghorofa tatu, na mwanga walioupata ulitoka kwenye dirisha lililokuwa juu. Mlango ulikuwa pembeni. Vyumba tofauti vilivyoandaliwa kwa ajili ya kupokea wanyama mbalimbali vilitengenezwa kiasi kwamba dirisha la juu lilitoa mwanga kwa vyote. Safina ilitengenezwa kwa mti wa sayprosi au mgofero, ambao haungejua kuoza kwa mamia ya miaka. Lilikuwa jengo la uimara mkubwa, ambalo hakuna hekima ya mwanadamu ingeweza kuvumbua. Mungu alikuwa msanifu, na Nuhu alikuwa mjenzi mkuu Wake.

Baada ya Nuhu kufanya kila kitu katika uwezo wake ili kuhakikisha kila sehemu ya kazi iko sahihi, haikuwezekana kwamba chombo hicho kingeweza kuhimili chenyewe vurugu za dhoruba ambayo Mungu katika ghadhabu Yake kali angeileta juu ya dunia. Kazi ya kukamilisha jengo hilo ilikuwa mchakato wa polepole. Kila kipande cha mbao kiliunganishwa kwa ukaribu, na kila mshono ulifunikwa na lami. Kila kitu ambacho wanadamu wangeweza kufanya kilifanyika ili kuifanya kazi hiyo kuwa kamilifu; hata hivyo, baada ya yote, Mungu pekee ndiye angeweza kulihifadhi jengo hilo juu ya mawimbi yenye hasira na yanayopanda, kwa nguvu Yake ya kimuujiza.

Umati wa watu hapo awali walionekana kupokea onyo la Nuhu, lakini hawakumgeukia Mungu kikamilifu kwa toba ya kweli. Kulikuwa na muda waliopewa kabla ya Gharika kuja, ambapo walipaswa kuwekwa katika kipindi cha majaribio—ili kuthibitishwa na kujaribiwa. Walishindwa kuvumilia jaribu hilo. Uharibifu uliokuwa umeenea uliwashinda, na hatimaye wakajiunga na wengine waliokuwa wapotovu katika kumdhihaki na kumfanyia mzaha Nuhu mwaminifu. Hawakuacha dhambi zao bali waliendelea katika mitala na kujiingiza katika tamaa zao mbaya.

Kipindi cha majaribio yao kilikuwa kikikaribia mwisho wake. Wakazi wa ulimwengu wasioamini na wenye kudhihaki walipaswa kuwa na ishara maalum ya nguvu ya kimungu ya Mungu. Nuhu alikuwa amefuata kwa uaminifu maelekezo ambayo Mungu alikuwa amempa. Safina ilikamilika sawasawa na vile Mungu alivyoelekeza. Alikuwa amehifadhi kiasi kikubwa cha chakula kwa ajili ya mwanadamu na mnyama. Na baada ya haya kukamilika, Mungu akamwamuru Nuhu mwaminifu, “Ingia wewe na nyumba yako yote katika safina; kwa maana nimekuona wewe kuwa ni mwenye haki mbele zangu.”

en: The cross reveals God’s love and justice
Christ bore the penalty of sin
Salvation is a gift through sacrifice
sw: Msalaba unaonyesha upendo na haki ya Mungu
Kristo alichukua adhabu ya dhambi
Wokovu ni zawadi kupitia dhabihu

en: Angels were sent to collect from the forest and field the beasts which God had created. Angels went before these animals, and they followed, two and two, male and female, and clean beasts by sevens. These beasts, from the most ferocious, down to the most gentle and harmless, peacefully and solemnly marched into the ark. The sky seemed clouded with birds of every description. They came flying to the ark, two and two, male and female, and the clean birds by sevens. The world looked on with wonder—some with fear, but they had become so hardened by rebellion that this most signal manifestation of God’s power had but a momentary influence upon them.

And as the doomed race beheld the sun shining in its glory and the earth clad in almost its Eden beauty, they drove away their rising fears by boisterous merriment, and by their deeds of violence seemed to be encouraging upon themselves the visitation of the already awakened wrath of God. Everything was now ready for the closing of the ark, which could not have been done by Noah from within. An angel is seen by the scoffing multitude descending from heaven, clothed with brightness like the lightning. He closes that massive outer door, and then takes his course upward to heaven again.

Seven days were the family of Noah in the ark before the rain began to descend upon the earth. In this time they were arranging for their long stay while the waters should be upon the earth. And these were days of blasphemous merriment by the unbelieving multitude. They thought, because the prophecy of Noah was not fulfilled immediately after he entered the ark, that he was deceived and that it was impossible that the world could be destroyed by a flood. Previous to this there had been no rain upon the earth. A mist had risen from the waters, which God caused to descend at night like dew, reviving vegetation.

Notwithstanding the solemn exhibition they had witnessed of God’s power—of the unnatural occurrence of the beasts’ leaving the forests and fields, and going into the ark, and the angel of God clothed with brightness and terrible in majesty descending from heaven and closing the door; yet they hardened their hearts and continued to revel and sport over the signal manifestations of divine power.
sw: Malaika walitumwa kukusanya kutoka mwituni na mashambani wanyama ambao Mungu alikuwa amewaumba. Malaika walitangulia mbele ya wanyama hawa, nao wakafuata, wawili wawili, dume na jike, na wanyama walio safi saba saba. Wanyama hawa, kuanzia wale wakali kupita kiasi, hadi wale wapole na wasio na madhara kabisa, waliingia ndani ya safina kwa amani na utulivu mkuu. Anga lilionekana kufunikwa na ndege wa kila aina. Walikuja wakiruka kuelekea kwenye safina, wawili wawili, dume na jike, na ndege walio safi saba saba. Ulimwengu ulitazama kwa mshangao—wengine kwa hofu, lakini walikuwa wamefanywa wagumu na uasi kiasi kwamba dhihirisho hili kuu la nguvu za Mungu lilikuwa na ushawishi wa kitambo kidogo tu juu yao.

Na wakati kizazi kilichohukumiwa kilipotazama jua liking’ara kwa utukufu wake na dunia ikiwa imevikwa uzuri karibu kama ule wa Edeni, walifukuza hofu zao zilizokuwa zikiongezeka kwa makelele ya sherehe, na kwa matendo yao ya ghasia walionekana kujitakia wenyewe ujio wa ghadhabu ya Mungu iliyokuwa tayari imeamshwa. Kila kitu sasa kilikuwa tayari kwa ajili ya kufungwa kwa safina, jambo ambalo lisingeweza kufanywa na Nuhu akiwa ndani. Malaika anaonekana na ule umati wenye kudhihaki akishuka kutoka mbinguni, akiwa amevikwa mwangaza kama wa umeme. Anaufunga ule mlango mkubwa wa nje, na kisha anapaa kuelekea mbinguni tena.

Siku saba familia ya Nuhu ilikuwa ndani ya safina kabla ya mvua kuanza kushuka juu ya nchi. Katika muda huu walikuwa wakijipanga kwa ajili ya kukaa kwao kwa muda mrefu wakati maji yatakapokuwa juu ya nchi. Na hizi zilikuwa siku za sherehe za kufuru kwa umati usioamini. Walifikiri kuwa, kwa sababu unabii wa Nuhu haukutimia mara tu baada ya kuingia katika safina, kwamba alikuwa amedanganywa na kwamba haiwezekani ulimwengu uharibiwe kwa gharika. Kabla ya hapo hapakuwa na mvua juu ya nchi. Ukungu ulikuwa ukipanda kutoka kwenye maji, ambao Mungu aliufanya ushuke usiku kama umande, ukihuisha mimea.

Licha ya dhihirisho lile la kicho walilolishuhudia la nguvu za Mungu—la tukio lisilo la kawaida la wanyama kuacha misitu na mashamba na kuingia ndani ya safina, na malaika wa Mungu aliyevikwa mwangaza na utukufu wa kutisha akishuka kutoka mbinguni na kufunga mlango; bado walifanya mioyo yao kuwa migumu na kuendelea kufanya anasa na michezo juu ya dhihirisho lile la wazi la nguvu za kimungu.

en: The cross reveals God’s love and justice
Christ bore the penalty of sin
Salvation is a gift through sacrifice
sw: Msalaba unaonyesha upendo na haki ya Mungu
Kristo alichukua adhabu ya dhambi
Wokovu ni zawadi kupitia dhabihu

en: But upon the eighth day the heavens gathered blackness. The muttering thunders and vivid lightning flashes began to terrify man and beast. The rain descended from the clouds above them. This was something they had never witnessed, and their hearts began to faint with fear. The storm increased in violence until water seemed to come from heaven like mighty cataracts. The foundations of the great deep also were broken up. Jets of water would burst up from the earth with indescribable force, throwing massive rocks hundreds of feet into the air.

The people first beheld the destruction of the works of their hands. Their splendid buildings, their beautifully arranged gardens and groves, where they had placed their idols, were destroyed by lightning from heaven. The violence of the storm increased, and there were mingled with the warring of the elements, the wailings of the people who had despised the authority of God. Even Satan himself, who was compelled to be amid the warring elements, feared for his own existence.

While many were blaspheming and cursing their Creator, others were frantic with fear, stretching their hands toward the ark, pleading for admittance. But this was impossible. God had closed the door, the only entrance, and shut Noah in and the ungodly out. Their fear and repentance came too late. Some clung to the ark until borne away with the furious surging of the waters. Every moment during that frightful storm of forty days and forty nights the preservation of the ark was a miracle of almighty power.

The storm did not abate its fury—the waters increased faster than at first. Upon the loftiest heights human beings and beasts strove to hold their position until all were hurled together into the foaming waters. Anxiously did Noah and his family watch the decrease of the waters. After seven days the dove was sent forth again, and when the olive leaf was seen in its mouth, there was great rejoicing. Again an angel descended and opened the door of the ark. Noah could remove the top, but he could not open the door which God had shut.
sw: Lakini siku ya nane mbingu zilikusanya weusi. Ngurumo za chini na miale ya umeme ilianza kuwatisha wanadamu na wanyama. Mvua ilishuka kutoka kwenye mawingu juu yao. Hili lilikuwa jambo ambalo hawajawahi kulishuhudia, na mioyo yao ilianza kuzimia kwa hofu. Dhoruba iliongezeka kwa ghasia hadi maji yalionekana kushuka kutoka mbinguni kama maporomoko makuu. Misingi ya vilindi vikuu pia ilipasuliwa. Chemchemi za maji zilibubujika kutoka duniani kwa nguvu isiyoelezeka, zikirusha mawe makubwa mamia ya futi hewani.

Watu kwanza walitazama uharibifu wa kazi za mikono yao. Majengo yao ya kifahari, bustani zao zilizopangwa vizuri na misitu midogo, ambapo walikuwa wameweka sanamu zao, viliharibiwa kwa umeme kutoka mbinguni. Ukali wa dhoruba uliongezeka, na katikati ya mapigano ya asili, kulichanganyika na vilio vya watu waliokuwa wamedharau mamlaka ya Mungu. Hata Shetani mwenyewe, ambaye alilazimika kuwa katikati ya vurugu hizo za asili, aliogopa kwa ajili ya kuwepo kwake mwenyewe.

Wakati wengi walikuwa wakimkufuru na kumlaani Muumba wao, wengine walikuwa na hofu kuu, wakinyoosha mikono yao kuelekea kwenye safina, wakisihi waingizwe. Lakini jambo hili haliwezekani. Mungu alikuwa amefunga mlango, kiingilio pekee, na kumfungia Nuhu ndani na waovu nje. Hofu yao na toba yao vilikuja kwa kuchelewa sana. Baadhi walishikilia safina hadi walipochukuliwa na mawimbi makali ya maji. Kila wakati katika dhoruba hiyo ya kutisha ya siku arobaini na usiku arobaini, kuhifadhiwa kwa safina kulikuwa muujiza wa nguvu za Mwenyezi.

Dhoruba haikupunguza ukali wake—maji yaliongezeka haraka kuliko hapo awali. Juu ya vilele virefu kabisa, wanadamu na wanyama walijitahidi kushikilia nafasi zao hadi wote walipotupwa pamoja katika maji yanayotoa povu. Kwa shauku Nuhu na familia yake walitazama kupungua kwa maji. Baada ya siku saba njiwa alitumwa tena, na jani la mzeituni lilipoonekana mdomoni mwake, palikuwa na furaha kubwa. Tena malaika alishuka na kufungua mlango wa safina. Nuhu aliweza kuondoa kifuniko cha juu, lakini hangeweza kufungua mlango ambao Mungu aliufunga.

en: The cross reveals God’s love and justice
Christ bore the penalty of sin
Salvation is a gift through sacrifice
sw: Msalaba unaonyesha upendo na haki ya Mungu
Kristo alichukua adhabu ya dhambi
Wokovu ni zawadi kupitia dhabihu

en: Noah did not forget God, who had so graciously preserved them, but immediately erected an altar and took of every clean beast, and of every clean fowl, and offered burnt offerings on the altar, showing his faith in Christ the great sacrifice, and manifesting his gratitude to God for their wonderful preservation. The offering of Noah came up before God like a sweet savor. He accepted the offering and blessed Noah and his family. Here a lesson is taught all who should live upon the earth, that for every manifestation of God’s mercy and love toward them the first act of all should be to render to Him grateful thanks and humble worship.

And lest man should be terrified with gathering clouds and falling rains, and should be in continual dread, fearing another flood, God graciously encourages the family of Noah by a promise. “And I will establish My covenant with you; neither shall all flesh be cut off any more by the waters of a flood; neither shall there any more be a flood to destroy the earth. And God said, This is the token of the covenant which I make between Me and you and every living creature that is with you, for perpetual generations: I do set My bow in the cloud, and it shall be for a token of a covenant between Me and the earth."

What a condescension on the part of God! What compassion for erring man, to place the beautiful, variegated rainbow in the clouds, a token of the covenant of the great God with man! This rainbow was to evidence the fact to all generations that God destroyed the inhabitants of the earth by a flood, because of their great wickedness. It was His design that as the children of aftergenerations should see the bow in the cloud and should inquire the reason of this glorious arch that spanned the heavens, their parents could explain to them the destruction of the old world by a flood.

This symbol in the clouds is to confirm the belief of all, and establish their confidence in God, for it is a token of divine mercy and goodness to man; that although God had been provoked to destroy the earth by the Flood, yet His mercy still encompasseth the earth. God says when He looketh upon the bow in the cloud He will remember. He would not have us understand that He would ever forget, but He speaks to man in his own language, that man may better understand Him.
sw: Nuhu hakumsahau Mungu, ambaye alikuwa amewahifadhi kwa neema, bali mara moja alijenga madhabahu na kuchukua katika kila mnyama aliye safi, na katika kila ndege aliye safi, na kutoa sadaka za kuteketezwa juu ya madhabahu, akionyesha imani yake kwa Kristo dhabihu kuu, na kudhihirisha shukrani zake kwa Mungu kwa uhifadhi wao wa ajabu. Sadaka ya Nuhu ilipanda mbele za Mungu kama harufu nzuri. Alikubali sadaka hiyo na kumbariki Nuhu na familia yake. Hapa fundisho linatolewa kwa wote wanaopaswa kuishi duniani, kwamba kwa kila udhihirisho wa rehema na upendo wa Mungu kwao, kitendo cha kwanza cha kila mmoja kinapaswa kuwa kutoa shukrani na ibada ya unyenyekevu Kwake.

Na ili mwanadamu asiogope mawingu yanayokusanyika na mvua inayonyesha, na kuwa katika hofu ya mara kwa mara, akihofia gharika nyingine, Mungu anaitia moyo familia ya Nuhu kwa neema kupitia ahadi. “Nami nitalifanya agano langu nanyi; wala kila mwenye mwili hatafutiliwa mbali tena kwa maji ya gharika; wala hakutakuwa na gharika tena kuiharibu nchi. Mungu akasema, Hii ndiyo ishara ya agano nifanyalo kati ya mimi na ninyi, na kila kiumbe hai kilichoko pamoja nanyi, kwa vizazi vya hata milele: Naweka upinde wangu mawinguni, nao utakuwa ishara ya agano kati ya mimi na nchi.”

Ni unyenyekevu ulioje kwa upande wa Mungu! Ni huruma iliyoje kwa mwanadamu anayekosea, kuweka upinde wa mvua mzuri, wenye rangi mbalimbali mawinguni, ishara ya agano la Mungu mkuu na mwanadamu! Upinde huu wa mvua ulikuwa uthibitishe ukweli kwa vizazi vyote kwamba Mungu aliwaangamiza wakazi wa dunia kwa gharika kwa sababu ya uovu wao mkubwa. Lilikuwa kusudi Lake kwamba watoto wa vizazi vya baadaye watakapoona upinde mawinguni na kuuliza sababu ya tao hili tukufu lililotanda mbinguni, wazazi wao wangeweza kuwaelezea uharibifu wa ulimwengu wa kale kwa gharika.

Ishara hii mawinguni ni kwa ajili ya kuthibitisha imani ya wote, na kuanzisha ujasiri wao kwa Mungu, kwani ni ishara ya rehema ya kimungu na wema kwa mwanadamu; kwamba ingawa Mungu alikuwa amechokozwa hata akaiharibu dunia kwa Gharika, bado rehema Yake inaizunguka dunia. Mungu anasema anapoutazama upinde mawinguni Atakumbuka. Hangependa tuelewe kwamba Anaweza kusahau kamwe, bali anazungumza na mwanadamu kwa lugha yake mwenyewe, ili mwanadamu apate kumwelewa vyema zaidi.

en: The cross reveals God’s love and justice
Christ bore the penalty of sin
Salvation is a gift through sacrifice
sw: Msalaba unaonyesha upendo na haki ya Mungu
Kristo alichukua adhabu ya dhambi
Wokovu ni zawadi kupitia dhabihu

en: “And I saw a new heaven and a new earth: for the first heaven and the first earth were passed away.” Revelation 21:1. The fire that consumes the wicked purifies the earth. Every trace of the curse is swept away. No eternally burning hell will keep before the ransomed the fearful consequences of sin. One reminder alone remains: our Redeemer will ever bear the marks of His crucifixion.

“O Tower of the flock, the strong hold of the daughter of Zion, unto thee shall it come, even the first dominion.” Micah 4:8. The kingdom forfeited by sin, Christ has regained, and the redeemed are to possess it with Him. “The righteous shall inherit the land, and dwell therein for ever.” Psalm 37:29.

A fear of making the saints’ inheritance seem too material has led many to spiritualize away the very truths which lead us to look upon the new earth as our home. Christ assured His disciples that He went to prepare mansions for them. Yet the apostle Paul declares, “Eye hath not seen, nor ear heard... the things which God hath prepared for them that love Him.”

In the Bible the inheritance of the saved is called a country. There the great Shepherd leads His flock to fountains of living waters. The tree of life yields its fruit every month. On those peaceful plains, beside those living streams, God’s people, so long pilgrims and wanderers, shall find a home.
sw: “Kisha nikaona mbingu mpya na nchi mpya; kwa maana mbingu za kwanza na nchi ya kwanza zimekwisha kupita.” Ufunuo 21:1. Moto unaowaangamiza waovu unaisafisha dunia. Kila alama ya laana inafagiliwa mbali. Hakuna hovyo la moto linalowaka milele litakaloweka mbele ya waliokombolewa matokeo ya kutisha ya dhambi. Kikumbusho kimoja tu kinabaki: Mwokozi wetu atazichukua daima alama za kusulubiwa Kwake.

“Nawe, Ee mnara wa kundi, kilima cha binti Sayuni, kitaletwa kwako, naam, ule utawala wa kwanza utakuja.” Mika 4:8. Ufalme uliopotea kwa sababu ya dhambi, Kristo ameurudisha, na waliokombolewa wataumiliki pamoja Naye. “Wenye haki watairithi nchi, nao watakaa humo milele.” Zaburi 37:29.

Hofu ya kufanya urithi wa watakatifu uonekane kama kitu halisi imewafanya wengi kuubadili kuwa wa kiroho tu na kuacha ukweli unaotufanya tuitazame nchi mpya kama nyumbani kwetu. Kristo aliwahakikishia wanafunzi Wake kwamba anakwenda kuwaandalia makao. Lakini mtume Paulo anasema, “Jicho halikuona, wala sikio halikusikia... mambo ambayo Mungu aliwaandalia wale wampandao.”

Katika Biblia urithi wa waliookolewa unaitwa nchi. Humo Mchungaji mkuu huwaongoza kundi Lake kwenye chemchemi za maji yaliyo hai. Mti wa uzima hutoa matunda yake kila mwezi. Katika nchi tambarare zenye amani, kando ya mito hiyo ya maji yaliyo hai, watu wa Mungu, ambao kwa muda mrefu walikuwa wasafiri na wapitaji, watapata nyumbani.

en: There is the New Jerusalem, “having the glory of God,” her light “like unto a stone most precious.” Revelation 21:11. In the city of God “there shall be no night.” We shall ever feel the freshness of the morning, and shall ever be far from its close. “I saw no temple therein: for the Lord God Almighty and the Lamb are the temple of it.” Revelation 21:22.

There immortal minds will study with never-failing delight the wonders of creative power, the mysteries of redeeming love. Every faculty will be developed, every capacity increased. The acquirement of knowledge will not weary the mind or exhaust the energies. There the grandest enterprises may be carried forward, the loftiest aspirations reached.

As the years of eternity roll, they will bring richer and more glorious revelations of God and of Christ. As knowledge is progressive, so will love, reverence, and happiness increase. The more men learn of God, the greater will be their admiration of His character.

“And every creature which is in heaven, and on earth... heard I saying, Blessing, and honour, and glory, and power, be unto Him that sitteth upon the throne, and unto the Lamb for ever and ever.” Revelation 5:13. Sin and sinners are no more, God’s entire universe is clean, and the great controversy is forever ended.
sw: Kuna Yerusalemu Mpya, “wenye utukufu wa Mungu,” na nuru yake “kama jiwe la thamani kubwa sana.” Ufunuo 21:11. Katika mji wa Mungu “hakutakuwa na usiku.” Daima tutahisi upya wa asubuhi, na daima tutakuwa mbali na mwisho wake. “Nami sikuona hekalu ndani yake; kwa maana Bwana Mungu Mwenyezi na Mwana-Kondoo ndio hekalu lake.” Ufunuo 21:22.

Huko akili zisizokufa zitajifunza kwa furaha isiyofifia maajabu ya nguvu za uumbaji, na mafumbo ya upendo unaokomboa. Kila kipaji kitaendelezwa, kila uwezo utaongezeka. Kujipatia maarifa hakutachosha akili wala kumaliza nguvu. Huko miradi mikubwa zaidi inaweza kuendelezwa, matarajio ya juu kabisa kufikiwa, na malengo makuu kutimizwa.

Na kadiri miaka ya umilele inavyopita, italeta ufunuo tajiri zaidi na wenye utukufu zaidi wa Mungu na wa Kristo. Kadiri maarifa yanavyoongezeka, ndivyo upendo, heshima, na furaha vitakavyoongezeka. Kadiri wanadamu wanavyojifunza zaidi kumhusu Mungu, ndivyo utakavyokuwa mkuu zaidi mshangao wao kwa tabia Yake.

“Na kila kiumbe kilichoko mbinguni, na juu ya nchi... nalikisikia kikisema, Baraka, na heshima, na utukufu, na uweza una Yeye aketiye juu ya kiti cha enzi, na Mwana-Kondoo hata milele na milele.” Ufunuo 5:13. Dhambi na wenye dhambi hawapo tena, ulimwengu wote wa Mungu ni msafi, na pambano kuu limekwisha milele.
